title: How to Make a Tree Trunk Clock

steps.headline: Find a dead tree.
steps.description: Cut a portion of the trunk and take it home with you.

steps.headline: Cut about ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) of the trunk.
steps.description: This will be the body of your clock.

steps.headline: Clean it well.
steps.description: Use sandpaper to smoothen the surface.

steps.headline: Get a clock set.
steps.description: You can use your old boring wall clock, or find any cheap clock you can recycle.

steps.headline: Trace the clock at the back of your tree trunk.
Grab your hammer and chisel and crave out a housing that will fit your clock.
steps.description: Also drill a hole in front of the tree trunk.

steps.headline: Insert the clock set in the housing.
Reinforce this with glue or double adhesive tape.
steps.description: That way, your clock will be secured and will not fall off.

steps.headline: Attach the hands of your clock.
Paint the time on your clock.
Mount it on top or at the back of your clock.
Hang it on your wall.
steps.description: Enjoy your new rustic inspired clock.

text: Find a dead tree. Cut a portion of the trunk and take it home with you. Cut about ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) of the trunk. This will be the body of your clock. Clean it well. Use sandpaper to smoothen the surface. Get a clock set. You can use your old boring wall clock, or find any cheap clock you can recycle. Trace the clock at the back of your tree trunk.  Grab your hammer and chisel and crave out a housing that will fit your clock. Also drill a hole in front of the tree trunk. Insert the clock set in the housing.  Reinforce this with glue or double adhesive tape. That way, your clock will be secured and will not fall off. Attach the hands of your clock.  Paint the time on your clock.  Grab a hook.  Mount it on top or at the back of your clock.  Hang it on your wall. Enjoy your new rustic inspired clock.
